summary: Feature request to lazily load webpack in the TypeScript SDK worker package to reduce bundle size and enable stripping webpack from containers. The user has demonstrated a working patch that uses dynamic require for the bundler module instead of eager loading.
userImpact: Users who need to optimize container size or reduce deployment artifacts are currently forced to include webpack even if they don't use the bundling feature.
rootCause: webpack and the bundler module are eagerly imported at the index/worker level, making them impossible to tree-shake or exclude from bundles even when unused.
proposedFix: Export a stub bundleWorkflowCode function that uses dynamic import internally to lazily load the actual implementation, or move bundler to an optional package that can be dynamically imported.
workaround: User demonstrated a patch on build outputs using dynamic require: require("./workflow/bundler").bundleWorkflowCode instead of eager imports. This requires patching compiled JavaScript.
keyQuote: By lazily loading workflow/bundler you can get away with deleting webpack and friends from the bundle
